thread.title: Donald Trump claims Barack Obama is behind White House leaks | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Donald Trump claims Barack Obama is behind White House leaks | London Evening Standard

author: David Gardner
title: Donald Trump claims Barack Obama is behind White House leaks | London Evening Standard
text:
Chrissy Teigen teases John Legend after he failed to win an Oscar 
Donald Trump has named former President Obama as the whistleblower leaking secrets about his administration. 
The extraordinary claim comes after weeks of Mr Trump complaining that he was being undermined by stories coming from behind closed doors at the White House. 
He was particularly incensed that details of his telephone calls with the leaders of Mexico and Australia were leaked to the media. 
In an interview to be broadcast today on Fox TV in the United States, the president claims that not only was Mr Obama behind the leaks, he was also responsible for stirring up troublesome crowds attending town hall rallies for Republicans over the past month. “I think President Obama’s behind it, because his people are certainly behind it.” - @POTUS on some of the protests around the country pic.twitter.com/YC3SEAYFts — FOX & friends (@foxandfriends) February 28, 2017 
Asked on the show ‘Fox and Friends’ if he believed Mr Obama was responsible for the leaks bedeviling his administration, he replied: "I think that President Obama is behind it because his people are certainly behind it. Barack Obama with clenched jaw as President Trump shook hands with senior figures at his inauguration 
"And some of the leaks possibly come from that group, which are really serious because they are very bad in terms of national security. But I also understand that is politics. In terms of him being behind things, that's politics. And it will probably continue," he added. 
The allegation, in clear breach of the traditional president’s code whereby former commanders-in-chief refrain from speaking ill of one another, is certain to destroy any semblance of a working relationship between tho two men. Donald Trump: We are fighting the phoney, fake news 
Perhaps unsurprisingly, Mr Trump didn’t shy away from making Mr Obama the scapegoat. 
Quizzed about whether Mr Obama was also involved in the town hall demonstrations, the president was quick to dish out the blame. Donald Trump suffers fresh blow over choice for top US Navy role 
"It turns out his organisation seems to do a lot of these organising to some of the protests that these Republicans are seeing around the country against you," he said. 
"No, I think he is behind it. I also think it is politics, that's the way it is. 
"You never know what's exactly happening behind the scenes. You know, you're probably right or possibly right, but you never know," Mr Trump said in the interview, a clip of which was released on Monday eveningt. 
The White House didn’t offer any evidence backing up the president’s allegations. 
Mr Trump has previously pointed a finger at "Obama people" for leaking classified information and harming national security. 
After details emerged of alleged phone conversations between his short-lived national Security Advisor Michael Flynn and Russia’s Ambassador in Washington, the president tweeted: "The spotlight has finally been put on the low-life leakers! They will be caught!" Sadiq Khan: President Trump can't silence me 
He added later: "We're looking at them very, very, very serious. I've gone to all of the folks in charge of the various agencies, and we’re - I've actually called the Justice Department to look into the leaks. Those are criminal leaks," he said. 
Just last Friday, the president tweeted: "The FBI is totally unable to stop the national security 'leakers' that have permeated our government for a long time. They can't even find the leakers within the FBI itself." 
He continued: "Classified information is being given to the media that could have devastating effect on US," adding in bold caps: "FIND NOW." More about:
